title: Lady Gaga has no idea what Fortnite is so Ninja helps her out
text:
Was Lady Gaga just trolling all the gamers? (Picture: Getty/Epic Games)

Lady Gaga clearly won’t be racing to buy the latest Fortnite release today as the popstar actually had to ask her Twitter followers exactly what the game was.

The Shallow singer caught wind of all the Fortnite buzz on Tuesday due to the release of the game’s Chapter 2, which has sent gamers around the world into a frenzy.

But perhaps Gaga, 33, isn’t much of a gamer after all as she posed the following question to her 79.7 million followers: ‘What’s fortnight [sic].’

Guessing she doesn’t have an XBox or PlayStation on her tour bus these days.

Needless to say, Gaga’s Twitter followers were absolutely stunned that she had no idea what Fortnite was – erm, only the biggest game on the planet – but they quickly filled her in with some brilliantly witty responses.

First up was Ninja, who has managed to accumulate an estimate net worth of $10 million (£7.8 million) from playing the game on Twitch (and now Mixer).

Advertisement

‘Call me on the Telephone. I’ll give you a Million Reasons to play. You and I,’ the streamer tweeted adding in a cheeky pun at the end relating to Gaga’s 2011 song.

Rapper Juicy J chimed in: ‘A very addictive video game that you can’t stop playing once you enter.’

Streaming platform Twitch teased: ‘We have some friends that can show you.’

Explaining it in terms Gaga would understand, the Twitter Gaming account replied: ‘It’s the ARTPOP of video games,’ referring to the singer’s third album.

Highly amused by Gaga’s ignorance, one follower weighed in: ‘This is just the funniest tweet to ever exist.’

Another joker who is clearly addicted to the game, quipped: ‘The length of my longest relationship.’

Fortnite: Chapter 2 was released earlier today (Picture: androidcentral.com)

And bringing it back to the music, one fan said in relation to Gaga’s elusive next album: ‘Did you just said FOR TONIGHT? like your new single is coming out TONIGHT???’

Of course, the singer could have just been trolling all those Fortnite fans as she previously admitted she was addicted to playing video game Bayonetta.

Last November, the singer tweeted: ‘When you beat Chapter IV of Bayonetta and then realize Chapter V is going to kick your ass secret #gamergirl THE SHADOW REMAINS TOUGH!!!!!!

‘Ok so I had to step away from the game for a minute to collect myself and now I’m in the middle of Chapter X and the battleships just WHHHHHY?!!!!!!!!! [sic]’

She added: ‘Still playing #Bayonetta middle of chapter XIII and my hands hurt and I have to sleep and it’s 4 In the damn morning but this damn dragon with the face that I have to kill with my weave. Smh. Give it another go in the morning #gamer respect to the experts I need emotional support [sic].’

Jeez, emotional support? Just don’t get her hooked on Fortnite, then.
